title: Ticket #2822: Improve cleanup of chroot execute dirs
description:
Right now, the chroot implementation has a few drawbacks:
  • It creates $CHROOT/var/lib/condor/execute with too-restrictive permissions if it doesn't already exist.
  • It implements the parsing of the NAMED_CHROOT param twice via the miracle of copy/paste
  • It bind-mounts /var/lib/condor/execute -> $CHROOT/var/lib/condor/execute. If we would instead bind-mount /var/lib/condor/execute/dir_12345 -> $CHROOT/var/lib/condor/execute/dir_12345, the running jobs wouldn't be able to scribble in each other's sandbox, even if they are running as the same unix user.
    • This is an important isolation/security protection!
  • If (3) is implemented, we would need to cleanup the various dir_12345 directories in the starter and startd.

All simple things to fix; patch incoming.
